member.name: P:SSMP.Api.Addon.Addon.ApiVersion
member.summary: The version of the API that this addon targets. If SSMP deems this too low (i.e. too outdated), it will not load the addon. The current version of the API that SSMP exposes is referenced in . Do not reference that value in this property directly. This property is to ensure that outdated addons that target APIs with removed/changed features are not loaded anymore to prevent issues.

member.name: M:SSMP.Game.Client.PauseManager.OnDeath
member.summary: Callback method for when the player dies. If we are paused while the player dies, the game enters a state where the cursor is visible while not in the pause menu, but not being able to give any input apart from opening the pause menu. Therefore, we unpause immediately before dying to prevent this.

member.summary: Properties for save data variables that denote things like whether to synchronise the values.

member.name: P:SSMP.Game.Client.Save.SaveDataMapping.VarProperties.Sync
member.summary: Whether to sync this value. If true, the variable indicates where to store the synced values.

member.name: P:SSMP.Game.Client.Save.SaveDataMapping.VarProperties.SyncType
member.summary: The sync type of this value. Type Player is used for player specific values and Server is used for global world specific values.

member.name: P:SSMP.Game.Client.Save.SaveDataMapping.VarProperties.IgnoreSceneHost
member.summary: Whether to ignore the check for scene host when sending/processing a save data for this value.

member.name: P:SSMP.Game.Client.Save.SaveDataMapping.VarProperties.VarType
member.summary: The type of the variable that holds this value.

member.name: P:SSMP.Game.Client.Save.SaveDataMapping.VarProperties.Additive
member.summary: Whether the value for this variable should be handled additively, i.e. by networking the delta of the value instead of the actual value. This is used for variables that can be modified by multiple players at once and thus can have incorrect values due to networking race conditions.

member.name: P:SSMP.Game.Client.Save.SaveDataMapping.VarProperties.InitialValue
member.summary: The initial value of the variable if it is not the default for the type. Otherwise, it will be null.

member.name: T:SSMP.Game.Client.Save.SaveDataMapping.SyncType
member.summary: The sync type for sync properties indicating whether values are global or player specific.

member.name: T:SSMP.Logging.ColorCodeParser
member.summary: Provides parsing utilities for Minecraft-style ampersand color codes and formatting.

remarks.para: Supported color codes: &0 through &9 (digits) and &a through &f (hex).
Special codes: &r (reset all formatting), && (escape sequence for literal ampersand).

This parser supports three output formats:
ANSI escape sequences for console output
Unity rich text tags for UI rendering
Plain text with all codes stripped

member.name: F:SSMP.Logging.ColorCodeParser.AnsiCodes
member.summary: Maps Minecraft color/style codes to their corresponding ANSI escape sequences.

member.name: F:SSMP.Logging.ColorCodeParser.UnityHexColors
member.summary: Maps Minecraft color codes to their corresponding hex color values for Unity.

member.name: M:SSMP.Logging.ColorCodeParser.ParseToAnsi(System.String)
member.summary: Converts Minecraft color codes to ANSI escape sequences for console output.
member.param: The input string containing Minecraft color codes.
member.returns: A string with color codes replaced by ANSI escape sequences.
member.remarks: Unrecognized codes are left as-is. Use && to output a literal ampersand.

member.name: M:SSMP.Logging.ColorCodeParser.ParseToUnityRichText(System.String)
member.summary: Converts Minecraft color codes to Unity rich text tags.
member.param: The input string containing Minecraft color codes.
member.returns: A string with color codes replaced by Unity rich text tags.
member.remarks: This overload does not support underline or strikethrough tags. Use the overload with explicit parameters if TextMeshPro support is needed.

member.name: M:SSMP.Logging.ColorCodeParser.ParseToUnityRichText(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts Minecraft color codes to Unity rich text tags with optional extended formatting support.
member.param: The input string containing Minecraft color codes.
If true, enables <u> tags for underline (&n).
If true, enables <s> tags for strikethrough (&m).
member.returns: A string with color codes replaced by Unity rich text tags.

remarks.para: Set and to true when using TextMeshPro.
All open tags are automatically closed at the end of the string.
The &r code closes all active formatting and color tags.

member.name: M:SSMP.Logging.ColorCodeParser.StripColorCodes(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all Minecraft color codes from a string, leaving only plain text.
member.param: The input string containing Minecraft color codes.
member.returns: A string with all recognized color codes removed.
member.remarks: Recognized codes are silently removed. Unrecognized codes are preserved. Use && to output a literal ampersand.

member.name: T:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver
member.summary: Class that processes and manages chunks by receiving slices of those chunks and sending acknowledgements for those slices. Uses delegate injection instead of inheritance for flexibility.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver._received
member.summary: Boolean array where each value indicates whether the slice of the same index was received.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver._chunkData
member.summary: Byte array that contains (parts of) the chunk data that is received.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver._isReceiving
member.summary: Whether we are currently receiving a chunk. If not, receiving a slice containing a chunk ID that is one higher that the last received chunk will start the reception process again.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver._chunkId
member.summary: The currently (if receiving) or last received (when not receiving) chunk ID.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver._chunkSize
member.summary: The size of the chunk that we are currently receiving. Only calculated when the last slice is received, since that is the only slice with a different slice size.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver._numSlices
member.summary: The number of slices that the chunk we are currently receiving contains. Set whenever we receive the first slice in a chunk.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver._numReceivedSlices
member.summary: The number of slices we have received so far. Used to keep track when all slices are received.

member.name: E:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver.ChunkReceivedEvent
member.summary: Event that is called when the entirety of a chunk is received.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver._setSliceAckData
member.summary: Delegate for setting slice acknowledgement data in the update manager.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver.#ctor(SSMP.Networking.Chunk.SetSliceAckDataDelegate)
member.summary: Construct the chunk receiver with the delegate for setting slice acknowledgement data.
member.param: Delegate to call when sending acknowledgement data.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver.ProcessReceivedData(SSMP.Networking.Packet.Data.SliceData)
member.summary: Process received slice data by checking whether we have not yet received this slice and adding it to the data array and marking it received. If this is the first slice received in this chunk we note that we are receiving, set the number of slices we expect to receive and increment the currently receiving chunk ID. If this is the last slice in the chunk we invoke the event that an entire chunk is received.
member.param: The received slice data.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver.Reset
member.summary: Reset the chunk receiver so it can be used for a new connection. This will reset most variables to their default values.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver.SendAckData
member.summary: Send acknowledgement data containing the boolean array of all slices that have been acknowledged thus far.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkReceiver.SoftReset
member.summary: Soft reset the chunk receiver by clearing the array of received slices and setting chunk size, number of slices, and number of received slices to 0.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkSender.ProcessReceivedData(SSMP.Networking.Packet.Data.SliceAckData)
member.summary: Process received slice acknowledgement data. First does sanity checks to see if we are actually sending a chunk, whether the received chunk ID matches the currently sending chunk ID, and whether the number of slices matches. Then for each of the slice indices in the acknowledgement array, it checks whether this is a newly acknowledged slice and locally marks it as acknowledged.
member.param: The received slice acknowledgement data.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkSender.StartSends(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Start the sending process with the given cancellation token. We block on the collection to take a new packet to start sending. Once a packet is taken from the collection, we calculate the chunk size and number of slices that we need to send. Then, wee go over the slices in ascending order and send one with a given delay between each slice. Each slice that is acknowledged already is skipped in the sending order. If we have already sent a given slice less than a certain threshold ago, we also skip sending it. Once all slices have been acknowledged, we go back to blocking on the collection to wait for a new chunk to send.
member.param: The cancellation token for cancelling the sending process.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkSender.SendNextSlice
member.summary: Send the next slice, whose ID is . This will figure out the start index of the data in the array and copy the data into a new array for adding to the update packet.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkSender.TryGetNextSliceToSend
member.summary: Try to get the next slice ID that we need to send. We simply iterate in ascending order over slice IDs until we find one that is not yet acknowledged. Each iteration we check whether the number of acknowledged slices equals the number of slices in the chunk, so we don't end up in an infinite loop.
member.returns: True if a next slice could be found, false if all slices are acknowledged.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Chunk.ChunkSender.SetSliceData(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send the given slice data using the injected delegate.
member.param: The ID of the chunk for this slice.
The ID of the slice.
The number of slices in this chunk.
The byte array containing the data of the slice.

member.name: T:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2
member.summary: Congestion manager that adjusts send rates based on RTT measurements. Only used for UDP/HolePunch transports. Steam transports bypass this entirely. Uses RttTracker for RTT measurements; reliability is handled by ReliabilityManager.
member.typeparam: The type of the outgoing packet.
The type of the packet ID.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.HighSendRate
member.summary: Number of milliseconds between sending packets if the channel is clear.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.LowSendRate
member.summary: Number of milliseconds between sending packet if the channel is congested.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.CongestionThreshold
member.summary: The round trip time threshold after which we switch to the low send rate.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.MaximumSwitchThreshold
member.summary: The maximum time threshold (in milliseconds) in which we need to have a good RTT before switching send rates.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.MinimumSwitchThreshold
member.summary: The minimum time threshold (in milliseconds) in which we need to have a good RTT before switching send rates.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.TimeSpentCongestionThreshold
member.summary: If we switch from High to Low send rates without spending this amount of time, we increase the switch threshold.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2._updateManager
member.summary: The update manager whose send rate we adjust.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2._rttTracker
member.summary: The RTT tracker for RTT measurements.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2._isChannelCongested
member.summary: Whether the channel is currently congested.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2._currentSwitchTimeThreshold
member.summary: The current time for which we need to have a good RTT before switching send rates.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2._spentTimeThreshold
member.summary: Whether we have spent the threshold in a high send rate. If so, we don't increase the switchTimeThreshold if we switch again.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2._belowThresholdStopwatch
member.summary: The stopwatch keeping track of time spent below the threshold with the average RTT.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2._currentCongestionStopwatch
member.summary: The stopwatch keeping track of time spent in either congested or non-congested mode.

member.summary: Construct the congestion manager with the given update manager and RTT tracker.

The RTT tracker for RTT measurements.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.OnReceivePacket
member.summary: Called when a packet is received to adjust send rates based on current RTT.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.AdjustSendRateIfNeeded
member.summary: Adjusts send rate between high and low based on current average RTT and congestion state. Implements adaptive thresholds to prevent rapid switching.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.HandleCongestedState
member.summary: Handles logic when channel is currently congested. Monitors if RTT drops below threshold long enough to switch back to high send rate.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.HandleNonCongestedState
member.summary: Handles logic when channel is not congested. Monitors if RTT exceeds threshold to switch to low send rate, and adjusts switch thresholds.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.SwitchToHighSendRate
member.summary: Switches from congested to non-congested mode with high send rate.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.SwitchToLowSendRate
member.summary: Switches from non-congested to congested mode with low send rate. Increases switch threshold if we didn't spend enough time in high send rate.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.DecreaseSwitchThreshold
member.summary: Decreases the switch threshold when stable time is spent in non-congested mode. Helps the system recover faster from temporary congestion.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.CongestionManager`2.IncreaseSwitchThreshold
member.summary: Increases the switch threshold when switching too quickly between modes. Prevents rapid oscillation between send rates.

member.summary: Thread-safe generic object pool for reducing allocations of frequently created objects. Uses ConcurrentBag for lock-free operations in most cases.
member.typeparam: Type of object to pool. Must be IPoolable and have parameterless constructor.

member.summary: Maximum number of objects to keep in the pool. Prevents unbounded memory growth.

member.summary: Thread-safe bag of pooled objects.

member.summary: Current approximate count of pooled objects.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Packet.Data.ObjectPool`1.Get
member.summary: Gets an object from the pool or creates a new one if pool is empty.
member.returns: A reset object ready for use.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Packet.Data.ObjectPool`1.Return(`0)
member.summary: Returns an object to the pool after resetting it. If pool is full, the object is simply discarded for GC.

member.summary: The ID of the chunk that is being networked.

member.summary: The total number of slices in this chunk. Encoded as a byte where all values are shifted by -1 to ensure we can encode 256 as a value, since we don't use 0.

member.name: P:SSMP.Networking.Packet.Data.SliceAckData.Acked
member.summary: Boolean array containing whether a slice was acked. For writing packets, the length of the array can equal the number of slices. For reading packets, the length of the array will equal the maximum possible number of slices per chunk.

member.summary: Create a bit flag as a byte from the given boolean array with start and end indices.

The (exclusive) end index to stop reading from the boolean array.
The boolean array to read values from for the flag.
member.returns: The bit flag as a byte.

member.summary: Read a bit flag in byte form and put the bits into the given reference boolean array.
member.param: The bit flag as a byte.
The (inclusive) start index to start reading from the boolean array.
The (exclusive) end index to stop reading from the boolean array.

member.summary: UDP Hole Punch transport (NAT traversal).

member.name: T:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport
member.summary: UDP Hole Punch implementation of . Performs NAT traversal before establishing DTLS connection for secure peer-to-peer networking.

remarks.para: This transport layer combines NAT hole-punching with DTLS encryption to enable secure peer-to-peer connections between clients behind NAT/firewalls.

NAT Hole Punching Process: 1. Client creates a socket and registers with MMS (which sees public endpoint) 2. Client sends "punch" packets to peer's public endpoint 3. These packets open a hole in the local NAT mapping 4. Peer's packets can now reach through the opened NAT hole 5. DTLS handshake proceeds over the established UDP path
The transport handles both: - Remote connections: Full hole-punching and DTLS - Local connections: Direct DTLS without hole-punching

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.UdpMaxPacketSize
member.summary: Maximum UDP packet size to avoid IP fragmentation. Set to 1200 bytes to safely fit within MTU after IP/UDP/DTLS headers.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.PunchPacketCount
member.summary: Number of punch packets to send during NAT traversal. Set to 100 packets (5 seconds total) to cover MMS polling latency.
member.remarks: High count ensures: - NAT mapping stays open long enough for peer to respond - Covers the time for MMS to notify host of pending client - Compensates for packet loss during hole-punching

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.PunchPacketDelayMs
member.summary: Delay between consecutive punch packets in milliseconds. 50ms provides good balance between NAT mapping refresh and network overhead.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.LocalhostAddress
member.summary: The IP address used for self-connecting (host connecting to own server). Localhost connections bypass hole-punching as no NAT traversal is needed.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.PunchPacket
member.summary: Pre-allocated punch packet bytes containing "PUNCH" in UTF-8. Reused across all punch operations to avoid allocations.
member.remarks: The actual content doesn't matter - we just need to send packets to establish the NAT mapping. "PUNCH" is used for debugging clarity.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport._dtlsClient
member.summary: The underlying DTLS client that provides encrypted communication. Handles encryption, decryption, and secure handshaking.

member.name: E:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.DataReceivedEvent
member.summary: Event raised when encrypted data is received from the peer. Data has already been decrypted by the DTLS layer.

member.name: P:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.RequiresCongestionManagement
member.summary: Indicates whether this transport requires congestion management. UDP provides no congestion control, so higher layers must implement it.

member.name: P:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.RequiresReliability
member.summary: Indicates whether this transport requires reliability mechanisms. UDP is unreliable, so higher layers must implement retransmission.

member.name: P:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.RequiresSequencing
member.summary: Indicates whether this transport requires sequencing mechanisms. UDP doesn't guarantee ordering, so higher layers must sequence packets.

member.name: P:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.MaxPacketSize
member.summary: Gets the maximum packet size that can be safely transmitted. Limited by MTU considerations to avoid fragmentation.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Sets up the DTLS client and subscribes to its data events.

member.summary: Connects to the specified remote endpoint with NAT traversal. Performs hole-punching for remote connections, direct connection for localhost.
member.param: The IP address to connect to
The port to connect to
member.remarks: Connection process: - Localhost: Direct DTLS connection (no hole-punching needed) - Remote: Hole-punch first, then DTLS connection over punched socket

member.summary: Checks if an IP address is a private (LAN) address.

member.summary: Sends encrypted data to the connected peer. Data is encrypted by the DTLS layer before transmission.
member.param: Buffer containing data to send
Offset in buffer where data begins
Number of bytes to send
member.exception: Thrown if not connected

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the peer and cleans up resources. Closes the DTLS session and underlying socket.

member.name: P:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.HolePunchSocket
member.summary: Pre-bound socket for NAT hole-punching. Created by ConnectInterface when joining a lobby, consumed by HolePunchEncryptedTransport.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.Transport.HolePunch.HolePunchEncryptedTransport.PerformHolePunch(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs UDP hole punching to the specified endpoint. Opens NAT mapping by sending packets, then returns connected socket for DTLS.
member.param: Target IP address
Target port
member.returns: Connected UDP socket ready for DTLS communication
member.exception: Thrown if hole punching fails
member.remarks: Hole-punching sequence: 1. Reuse pre-bound socket from STUN discovery (or create new one) 2. Configure socket to ignore ICMP Port Unreachable errors 3. Send 100 "PUNCH" packets over 5 seconds to open NAT mapping 4. Connect socket to peer endpoint 5. Return socket for DTLS handshake

member.name: T:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2
member.summary: Class that manages sending the update packet. Has a simple congestion avoidance system to avoid flooding the channel.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: The time in milliseconds to disconnect after not receiving any updates.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.PacketMtu
member.summary: The MTU (maximum transfer unit) to use to send packets with. If the length of a packet exceeds this, we break it up into smaller packets before sending. This ensures that we control the breaking of packets in most cases and do not rely on smaller network devices for the breaking up as this could impact performance. This size is lower than the limit for DTLS packets, since there is a slight DTLS overhead for packets.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.SequenceWrapThreshold
member.summary: Threshold for sequence number wrap-around detection.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._rttTracker
member.summary: The RTT tracker for measuring round-trip times. Lazily initialized only when transport requires sequencing.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._reliabilityManager
member.summary: The reliability manager for packet loss detection and resending. Lazily initialized only when transport requires reliability.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._congestionManager
member.summary: The UDP congestion manager instance. Null if congestion management is disabled. Lazily initialized only when transport requires sequencing.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._receivedSequences
member.summary: List containing sequence numbers that have been received within the ACK window. Uses linear lookups which is faster than HashSet for small collections (N=64). Lazily initialized only when transport requires sequencing.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._sendThread
member.summary: Thread for running the precise send loop. Replaces System.Timers.Timer for better consistency and reduced jitter.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._cancellationTokenSource
member.summary: Cancellation token source to stop the send loop safely.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._lastReceiveTime
member.summary: The timestamp of the last received packet. Used to check for connection timeouts.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._requiresSequencing
member.summary: Cached capability: whether the transport requires application-level sequencing.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._localSequence
member.summary: The last sent sequence number.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._remoteSequence
member.summary: The last received sequence number.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._isUpdating
member.summary: Whether this update manager is actually updating and sending packets.

member.name: F:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2._transportSender
member.summary: The transport sender instance to use to send packets. Can be either IEncryptedTransport (client-side) or IEncryptedTransportClient (server-side).

member.summary: The current update packet being assembled. Protected for subclass access.

member.summary: Lock object for synchronizing packet assembly. Protected for subclass access.

member.name: P:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.RequiresReliability
member.summary: Whether the transport requires application-level reliability. Protected for subclass access.

member.summary: Sets the transport client for server-side communication. Captures transport capabilities when set.

member.summary: Lazily initializes managers only when the transport requires them. RttTracker is always initialized for ping display, even for Steam.

member.name: P:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.CurrentSendRate
member.summary: The current send rate in milliseconds between sending packets.

member.summary: Event that is called when the client times out.

member.summary: Construct the update manager with a UDP socket.

member.summary: Start the update manager. This will start the send thread and heartbeat timer.

member.summary: Stop sending the periodic UDP update packets after sending the current one.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.OnReceivePacket``2(``0)
member.summary: Callback method for when a packet is received.
member.param: The received packet.
member.typeparam: The type of the incoming packet.
The packet ID type of the incoming packet.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.CreateAndSendPacket
member.summary: Creates an update packet with current data and sends it through the transport. For UDP/HolePunch: handles sequence numbers, ACK fields, and congestion management. For Steam: bypasses reliability features and sends packet directly. Automatically fragments packets that exceed MTU size.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.PopulateAckField
member.summary: Populates the ACK field with acknowledgment bits for recently received packets. Each bit indicates whether a packet with that sequence number was received. Only used for UDP/HolePunch transports. Uses linear search (Contains) which is efficient for small size (N=64).

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.AddReceivedSequence(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Adds a received sequence number to the tracking set and maintains window size. Removes sequences outside the ACK window to prevent unbounded growth.
member.param: The sequence number to add.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.SendWithFragmentation(SSMP.Networking.Packet.Packet,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a packet, fragmenting it into smaller chunks if it exceeds the MTU size. Fragments are sent sequentially to ensure they can be reassembled by the receiver. Uses CopyTo to avoid an extra full-buffer ToArray() allocation when fragmenting.
member.param: The packet to send, which may be fragmented if too large.
Whether the packet data needs to be delivered reliably.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.NotifyAckReceived(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Notifies RTT tracker and reliability manager that an ACK was received for the given sequence.
member.param: The acknowledged sequence number.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.Reset
member.summary: Resets the update manager state, clearing queues and sequences.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.SendLoop
member.summary: Precision loop running on a dedicated thread to send updates at regular intervals. Uses ManualResetEventSlim for efficient waiting with cancellation support.

member.name: M:SSMP.Networking.UpdateManager`2.IsSequenceGreaterThan(System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Check whether the first given sequence number is greater than the second given sequence number. Accounts for sequence number wrap-around, by inverse comparison if differences are larger than half of the sequence number space.
member.param: The first sequence number to compare.
The second sequence number to compare.
member.returns: True if the first sequence number is greater than the second sequence number.

member.summary: Resend the given packet that was (supposedly) lost by adding data that needs to be reliable to the current update packet.
member.param: The packet instance that was lost.

member.summary: Sends the given packet over the corresponding medium.

member.summary: Build a string containing the open tags given in the list.

member.returns: A string of concatenated open tags.

member.summary: Filter out all color tags from the given list.

member.returns: A new list of strings containing only non-color tags.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Chat.ChatBox.RemoveEmptyColorTags(System.String)
member.summary: Removes empty color tags from the given text.
member.param: The text as a string.
member.returns: A new string that has all empty color tags removed.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Chat.ChatBox.TrimLeadingClosingTags(System.String)
member.summary: Trims all leading closing tags from the given text.
member.param: The text as a string.
member.returns: A new string that has all leading closing tags removed or the same string as the input.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Chat.ChatBox.TrimLeadingDanglingAngles(System.String)
member.summary: Trims all leading dangling angle brackets from the given text.
member.param: The text as a string.
member.returns: A new string with leading dangling angle brackets removed or the same string as the input.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Chat.ChatBox.NormalizeLeadingColorOpens(System.String)
member.summary: Normalize all leading color open tags at the start of the given text. This means that if multiple leading color opening tags are found, only the last will be included in the returned value, because all others would be overridden anyway.
member.param: The text as a string.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Chat.ChatBox.StartsWithColorAfterSkippablePrefix(System.String)
member.summary: Whether the given text starts with a color tag after skipping prefixes (whitespace and certain other characters).
member.param: The text as a string.
member.returns: True if the text starts with a color tag after skipping prefixes, false otherwise.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Chat.ChatBox.EnsureLeadingCharForRichText(System.String)
member.summary: Ensure that the given text starts with a zero-width space before the first angled bracket. This is to ensure that Unity does not see the angled bracket as a start for rich-text.
member.param: The text as a string.
member.returns: The string with a zero-width space prefixed if necessary.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Chat.ChatBox.HasVisibleContent(System.String)
member.summary: Whether the given text has any visible content (i.e. not only tags).
member.param: The text as a string.
member.returns: True if the text has visible content, false otherwise.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Chat.ChatBox.StripRichTextTags(System.String)
member.summary: Strips rich-text tags from the given text.
member.param: The text as a string.
member.returns: A new string with the rich-text tags removed.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Component.TextComponent.GetPreferredWidth
member.summary: Gets the preferred width required to render the component's text without wrapping.
member.returns: The preferred width in pixels.

remarks.para: NOTE: This method is currently unused by the ChatBox implementation. ChatBox performs dynamic text measurement on arbitrary strings during its wrapping algorithm, which requires direct use of with custom settings rather than querying an existing component's preferred width.

This method is retained for potential future use cases where measuring the preferred width of an already-instantiated text component may be needed, such as:
Dynamic UI layout systems
Tooltip sizing
Button auto-sizing based on text content

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Menu.ModMenu.#ctor(SSMP.Game.Settings.ModSettings,SSMP.Game.Client.ClientManager,SSMP.Game.Server.ServerManager,SSMP.Networking.Client.NetClient)
member.summary: Constructs the mod menu class for SSMP.
member.param: The mod settings for SSMP.
The client manager to register a callback for when server settings are updated.
The server manager to get the initial server settings and update them if we are not connected to a server.
The net client to network changes to the server settings if we are connected to a server.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Menu.ModMenu.RunActionWhenNoChanges(System.Action,UnityEngine.Coroutine@)
member.summary: Run the given action after a delay (defined in ) and store the delayed execution coroutine in the referenced variable. If this method is called again with the same referenced coroutine before the action is executed, it will be cancelled and a new delayed execution is scheduled. Can be used to apply the changing of certain settings only if the user stops modifying the setting for a certain period of time.
member.param: The action to execute delayed if this method is not called again within a certain period of time.
The coroutine containing the previous delayed execution of the action. This variable will be used to store the new coroutine.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Menu.ModMenu.HandleUpdateServerSettings
member.summary: Handles updates to the server settings. Checks whether we are connected to a server and only sends updates if no changes were made to the local server settings in this class for a certain period of time to prevent sending unnecessary updates.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.Menu.ModMenu.OnClientConnectionChange(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Callback method for the client connection changes, when either connected or disconnected from a server. This will modify the team selection depending on whether team selection should be allowed or not.

member.param: Whether to allow the player to select a team.

member.name: M:SSMP.Ui.UiManager.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the UI manager by creating all UI components and registering event hooks. Should be called once during mod startup.
member.remarks: Initialization process: 1. Registers hooks for UI state changes (paused, scene changes) 2. Registers language hooks for multiplayer button text 3. Sets up event hooks for menu navigation 4. Creates all UI components (connection menu, chat, ping) 5. Registers input checking for hotkeys
